commit_message:
monkey patch get_member(s) to get status

The only way to get the statuses for the pool member is to query
midonet API.  In order to do so, LBaaS DB mixin's get_member and
get_members are monkey patched so that member statuses are retrieved
before the response gets sent back to the user.

Change-Id: I8cfb09ff8ab41f672e2fa129b0fd6c32b94a22d6
Closes-Bug: #1508502
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/11/297711/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_member_status_set(self): with self.pool(subnet_id=self._subnet_id) as pool: with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id']) as member: m_id = member['member']['id'] self.client_mock.get_member.return_value = { 'id': m_id, 'status': constants.INACTIVE } req = self.new_show_request('members', m_id) res = self.deserialize(self.fmt, req.get_response(self.ext_api)) # Verify that it's not the default ACTIVE self.assertEqual(constants.INACTIVE, res['member']['status']) def test_get_member_client_error(self): self.client_mock.get_member.side_effect = Exception("Fake Error") with self.pool(subnet_id=self._subnet_id) as pool: with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id']) as member: m_id = member['member']['id'] req = self.new_show_request('members', m_id) res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(exc.HTTPOk.code, res.status_int) body = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) # Should be default status (ACTIVE) self.assertEqual(constants.ACTIVE, body['member']['status']) def test_list_members_statuses_set(self): with self.pool(subnet_id=self._subnet_id) as pool: with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id'], address="10.0.0.1") as member1: with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id'], address="10.0.0.2") as member2: m1_id = member1['member']['id'] m2_id = member2['member']['id'] status_map = { m1_id: constants.INACTIVE, m2_id: constants.ACTIVE } self.client_mock.get_members.return_value = [ {'id': m1_id, 'status': status_map[m1_id]}, {'id': m2_id, 'status': status_map[m2_id]}, ] req = self.new_list_request('members') res = self.deserialize(self.fmt, req.get_response(self.ext_api)) members = res['members'] self.assertEqual(2, len(members)) for member in members: self.assertEqual(status_map[member['id']], member['status']) def test_list_members_client_error(self): self.client_mock.get_members.side_effect = Exception("Fake Error") with self.pool(subnet_id=self._subnet_id) as pool: with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id'], address="10.0.0.1") as member1: with self.member(pool_id=pool['pool']['id'], address="10.0.0.2") as member2: req = self.new_list_request('members') res = req.get_response(self.ext_api) self.assertEqual(exc.HTTPOk.code, res.status_int) body = self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) members = body['members'] self.assertEqual(2, len(members)) # Should be default status (ACTIVE) for member in members: self.assertEqual(constants.ACTIVE, member['status'])

commit_message:
Document retrieving logs from the deploy ramdisk

This patch is documenting how operators can configure Ironic to be able
to retrieve the logs from the deploy ramdisk (or disable it).

Closes-Bug: #1587143
Change-Id: I233e925f4dd9a1aa04a722eb852a6f95c74603f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/83/352483/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Retrieving logs from the deploy ramdisk --------------------------------------- When troubleshooting deployments (specially in case of a deploy failure) it's important to have access to the deploy ramdisk logs to be able to identify the source of the problem. By default, Ironic will retrieve the logs from the deploy ramdisk when the deployment fails and save it on the local file-system at ``/var/log/ironic/deploy``. To change this behaviour operators can make the following changes to ``/etc/ironic/ironic.conf`` under the ``[agent]`` group: * ``deploy_logs_collect``: Whether Ironic should collect the deployment logs on deployment. Valid values for this option are: * ``on_failure`` (**default**): Retrieve the deployment logs upon a deployment failure. * ``always``: Always retrieve the deployment logs, even if the deployment succeed. * ``never``: Disable retrieving the deployment logs. * ``deploy_logs_storage_backend``: The name of the storage backend where the logs will be stored. Valid values for this option are: * ``local`` (**default**): Store the logs in the local file-system. * ``swift``: Store the logs in Swift. * ``deploy_logs_local_path``: The path to the directory where the logs should be stored, used when the ``deploy_logs_storage_backend`` is configured to ``local``. By default logs will be stored at **/var/log/ironic/deploy**. * ``deploy_logs_swift_container``: The name of the Swift container to store the logs, used when the deploy_logs_storage_backend is configured to "swift". By default **ironic_deploy_logs_container**. * ``deploy_logs_swift_days_to_expire``: Number of days before a log object is marked as expired in Swift. If None, the logs will be kept forever or until manually deleted. Used when the deploy_logs_storage_backend is configured to "swift". By default **30** days. When the logs are collected, Ironic will store a *tar.gz* file containing all the logs according to the ``deploy_logs_storage_backend`` configuration option. All log objects will be named with the following pattern:: <node-uuid>[_<instance-uuid>]_<timestamp yyyy-mm-dd-hh:mm:ss>.tar.gz .. note:: The *instance_uuid* is not a required field for deploying a node when Ironic is configured to be used in standalone mode so, if present it will be appended to the name. Accessing the log data ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ When storing the logs in the local file-system, the log files can be found at the path configured in the ``deploy_logs_local_path`` configuration option. For example, to find the logs from the node ``5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668``: .. code-block:: bash $ ls /var/log/ironic/deploy | grep 5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668 5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668_88595d8a-6725-4471-8cd5-c0f3106b6898_2016-08-08-13:52:12.tar.gz 5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668_db87f2c5-7a9a-48c2-9a76-604287257c1b_2016-08-08-14:07:25.tar.gz .. note:: When saving the logs to the file-system, operators may want to enable some form of rotation for the logs to avoid disk space problems. When using Swift, operators can associate the objects in the container with the nodes in Ironic and search for the logs for the node ``5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668`` using the **prefix** parameter. For example: .. code-block:: bash $ swift list ironic_deploy_logs_container -p 5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668 5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668_88595d8a-6725-4471-8cd5-c0f3106b6898_2016-08-08-13:52:12.tar.gz 5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668_db87f2c5-7a9a-48c2-9a76-604287257c1b_2016-08-08-14:07:25.tar.gz To download a specific log from Swift, do: .. code-block:: bash $ swift download ironic_deploy_logs_container "5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668_db87f2c5-7a9a-48c2-9a76-604287257c1b_2016-08-08-14:07:25.tar.gz" 5e9258c4-cfda-40b6-86e2-e192f523d668_db87f2c5-7a9a-48c2-9a76-604287257c1b_2016-08-08-14:07:25.tar.gz [auth 0.341s, headers 0.391s, total 0.391s, 0.531 MB/s]

commit_message:
Disallow enbling a plugin with legacy tasks

When plugin contains legacy tasks enabling it makes no effect unless
propagate_task_deploy attribute is set. The plugin silently does
nothing. In order to avoid confusion enabling is prohibited explicitly.

Change-Id: I4acfb24de02ac4a5cfb25e9c8d5a3a03d5b58e77
Partial-Bug: 1596928
(cherry picked from commit 4a333ec2da82da268b493eb8bf5f4e595c86f699)

Change-Id: Idd02769f98078702404a11dc9f7a3339ce4e22eb
Partially-Implements: blueprint bay-rollback-on-update-failure

commit_message:
Rollback bay on update failure

There is a rollback mechanism in heat after the stack
update failed. There should be a rollback mechanism in
magnum after bay update failed.

This patch add new microversion 1.3 to add rollback
support for Magnum bay, user can enable rollback on bay
update failure by specifying microversion 1.3 in header(
{'OpenStack-API-Version': 'container-infra 1.3'}) and
passing 'rollback=True'(http://XXX/v1/bays/XXX/?rollback=True)
when issuing bay update reqeust.

Change-Id: Idd02769f98078702404a11dc9f7a3339ce4e22eb
Partially-Implements: blueprint bay-rollback-on-update-failure
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/78/343478/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS = 'ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS'

commit_message:
Correct '.' to ':'

As item 1, 2 and 3 are ended with semicolon ':', only item 4 ends
with perioid '.'. Correct it.

Change-Id: Ibb75711fbf28c03362f37553b5a5092a6556c977

added_lines: from swift.common import swob, utils class TestSwiftInfo(unittest.TestCase): def setUp(self): utils._swift_info = {} utils._swift_admin_info = {} def test_registered_defaults(self): versioned_writes.filter_factory({})('have to pass in an app') swift_info = utils.get_swift_info() # in default, versioned_writes is not in swift_info self.assertNotIn('versioned_writes', swift_info) def test_registered_explicitly_set(self): versioned_writes.filter_factory( {'allow_versioned_writes': 'true'})('have to pass in an app') swift_info = utils.get_swift_info() self.assertTrue('versioned_writes' in swift_info) self.assertEqual( swift_info['versioned_writes'].get('allowed_versions_mode'), ['stack', 'history']) if __name__ == '__main__': unittest.main()

Improve docs for v3 ec2

In preparation to add functional tests for v3 ec2, this
change proposes to detail the method docs, because the
tests need to be based on them.

added_lines: """Represents an EC2 resource. Attributes: * id: a string that identifies the EC2 resource. * user_id: the ID field of a pre-existing user in the backend. * project_id: the ID field of a pre-existing project in the backend. """ """Create a new access/secret pair. :param user_id: the ID of the user having access/secret pair. :type user_id: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :param project_id: the ID of the project having access/secret pair. :type project_id: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.projects.Project` :returns: the created access/secret pair returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.ec2` def get(self, user_id, access): """Retrieve an access/secret pair. for a given access key. :param user_id: the ID of the user whose access/secret pair is to be retrieved from the server. :type user_id: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :param access: the access key whose access/secret pair is to be retrieved from the server. :type access: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :returns: the specified access/secret pair returned from server. :rtype: :class:`keystoneclient.v3.ec2` def list(self, user_id): """List access/secret pairs. :param str user_id: the ID of the user having access/secret pairs to be filtered on. :returns: a list of access/secret pairs. :rtype: list of :class:`keystoneclient.v3.ec2` """ return self._list("/users/%s/credentials/OS-EC2" % user_id, response_key="credentials") def delete(self, user_id, access): """Delete an access/secret pair. :param user_id: the ID of the user whose access/secret pair to be deleted on the server. :type user_id: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :param access: the access key whose access/secret pair to be deleted on the server. :type access: str or :class:`keystoneclient.v3.users.User` :returns: Response object with 204 status. :rtype: :class:`requests.models.Response` """
deleted_lines: """Create a new access/secret pair for the user/project pair. :rtype: object of type :class:`EC2` def list(self, user_id): """Get a list of access/secret pairs for a user_id. :rtype: list of :class:`EC2` """ return self._list("/users/%s/credentials/OS-EC2" % user_id, response_key="credentials") def get(self, user_id, access): """Get the access/secret pair for a given access key. :rtype: object of type :class:`EC2` def delete(self, user_id, access): """Delete an access/secret pair for a user."""

"""drop_task_execution_unique_key_column Revision ID: 018 Revises: 017 Create Date: 2016-08-15 00:25:34.149057 """ # revision identifiers, used by Alembic. revision = '018' down_revision = '017' from alembic import op import sqlalchemy as sa def upgrade(): op.drop_index('unique_key', table_name='task_executions_v2') op.drop_column('task_executions_v2', 'unique_key') op.alter_column( 'task_executions_v2', 'id', type_=sa.String(250), nullable=False ) op.alter_column( 'action_executions_v2', 'task_execution_id', type_=sa.String(250) ) op.alter_column( 'workflow_executions_v2', 'task_execution_id', type_=sa.String(250) )

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-14 17:23:05.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/engine/tasks.py', 'mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/workflow/commands.py', 'mistral/db/sqlalchemy/model_base.py', 'mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/38d2dce575be552b3c840f8bf64eb7d399a6bcab', 'message': "Fix the deadlock occuring on task executions

* When inserting multiple task executions we sometimes got into
  a dead lock where transaction A would wait for an exclusive
  (write) lock on 'unique_key' of some task execution and
  transaction B would hold that lock on 'unique_key' but waiting
  for a gap lock for primary key holding by transaction A.
  Solution: remove 'unique_key' column and expand 'id for
  task executions where in case of 'join' tasks (and any tasks
  with preconditions) we just store a unique key identifying
  a certaint join task in a certain workflow. By doing that
  we eliminate two locks that transactions can possibly compete
  for and leave just one (primary key).

Change-Id: I8976b662504afd5cef3a331e1b44047ed3203577

commit_message:
Fix the deadlock occuring on task executions

* When inserting multiple task executions we sometimes got into
  a dead lock where transaction A would wait for an exclusive
  (write) lock on 'unique_key' of some task execution and
  transaction B would hold that lock on 'unique_key' but waiting
  for a gap lock for primary key holding by transaction A.
  Solution: remove 'unique_key' column and expand 'id for
  task executions where in case of 'join' tasks (and any tasks
  with preconditions) we just store a unique key identifying
  a certaint join task in a certain workflow. By doing that
  we eliminate two locks that transactions can possibly compete
  for and leave just one (primary key).

TODO:
* DB migration for DB schema changes

Change-Id: I8976b662504afd5cef3a331e1b44047ed3203577

* Dropped a composite index for ('execution_time', 'processing'),
  left only 'execution_time' because 'processing' is boolean
  and indexing booleans doesn't give any performance improvement
* On a high load MySQL sometimes goes into a deadlock when
  we were using unique key constraint for (unique_key, processing)
  on 'insert' and 'update' operations. It was possible to reproduce
  this kind of deadlock locally in 3 MySQL consoles where one TX
  was doing 'update ... where' and two others were doing 'insert'.

  with composite primary key ('key', 'processing'). In this case
  the deadlock never happens (seems like PK are handled more
  efficiently).

  on operations 'update ... where' when running more than one
  scheduler. It's solvable by either using a buck update
  operation or slightly smarter handling of such error. On
  Postgres some special handling is required because it always
  switch a TX into 'rollback-only' mode on any SQL error.

commit_message:
Optimize Scheduler DB schema

* Dropped a composite index for ('execution_time', 'processing'),
  left only 'execution_time' because 'processing' is boolean
  and indexing booleans doesn't give any performance improvement
* On a high load MySQL sometimes goes into a deadlock when
  we were using unique key constraint for (unique_key, processing)
  on 'insert' and 'update' operations. It was possible to reproduce
  this kind of deadlock locally in 3 MySQL consoles where one TX
  was doing 'update ... where' and two others were doing 'insert'.
  This composite unique key constraint was dropped and replaced
  with composite primary key ('key', 'processing'). In this case
  the deadlock never happens (seems like PK are handled more
  efficiently).

TODO:
* There's still an issue with duplicate entries for delayed calls
  on operations 'update ... where' when running more than one
  scheduler. It's solvable by either using a buck update
  operation or slightly smarter handling of such error. On
  Postgres some special handling is required because it always
  switch a TX into 'rollback-only' mode on any SQL error.

Change-Id: I1f48e4b01e94c5328ccae3067e5bdd2c52d98417
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/45/354845/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

For example 'update on match'. id = sa.Column( sa.String(36), unique=True, default=utils.generate_unicode_uuid ) # Indexed column used for searching calls that are ready to be invoked. execution_time = sa.Column(sa.DateTime, nullable=False) # Description of a method and how it should be called.

commit_message:
Make container creation aysnc

Creating a container might take a while, which cause a RPC timeout
error. Therefore, let's make it aysnc.

Change-Id: I681ebce93868d90769020802b0eb8eeea11be083

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.3.2

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: I1104152b177cdf745203c48be9d2466f78a7f4b8
Depends-On: Id875cc0a8013fbf89bf95848937083d12eadf0e0

commit_message:
Rework version negotiation

This is the last patch in a series of revision to the version
negtiation. The negotiation logic is now migrated to the version
specific controller.

Change-Id: I56530639f4de77ea449aa5068f309f2980403fa6

resource.

commit_message:
Add unit tests for nova.virt.firewall.IpTablesFirewallDriver (Part 3)

There are no unit tests for the base IptablesFirewallDriver.
This patch adds those unit tests.
(This is the third part of the abandoned commit
Ie5372b060da1621927a638af915e15f29e885a4c )

Co-Authored-By:
Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit Ia9ef5ead95508cfb27b53b9899a9cfe97d150662)

Chen Li <shchenli@cn.ibm.com>
(Cherry picked from commit Ie2827051e1795c717f8a7762b932a49d182891cd

Change-Id: Iebeac33a4290bdafc4e6d9be80fb704f2f29652f
Partial-bug: #1295889

Tests that sec group rules that contain a CIDR (i.e. the # rule does not contain a grantee group of instances) populates # the returned iptables rules with appropriate ingress and # egress filters. sec_grp_list_mock.get_by_instance.return_value = [ mock.sentinel.sec_grp ] sec_grp_rule_list_mock.get_by_security_group.return_value = [ { "cidr": "192.168.1.0/24", "protocol": "tcp", "to_port": "22", "from_port": "22" } ] v4_rules, v6_rules = driver.instance_rules(i_mock, ni_mock) expected = [ # '-j ACCEPT -p tcp --dport 22 -s 192.168.1.0/24', '-j $sg-fallback' ] self.assertEqual(expected, v4_rules) expected = ['-j $sg-fallback'] self.assertEqual(expected, v6_rules)

commit_message:
Move fernet utils into keystone/common/

If we are going to be using fernet utilities to implement encryption of
credentials at rest, we should put the utilities in a more available
place.

bp credential-encryption

Change-Id: I06aff77836527885b3df1cbd25834906cda73910

commit_message:
Enable Gnocchi by default

Ceilometer is set to use Gnocchi dispatch when Gnocchi is deployed.
All references to MongoDB in the AIO are removed.

Partial-Blueprint: role-gnocchi
Depends-On: I94e7d461376a8032a76ea34b57190077a60a0fb5
Change-Id: Ia41141e947d48426c7d490497639d62e8dff6f8e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 05:07:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/0e2a0702f40431973876d4abbf7e61d7e8637c94', 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

When we running the tox, we are may always meeting the problem of
"db type could not be determined" on py34, we have to run the py34 first,
and then, run py27. So the patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini, which will
solve the problem above effectively.

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

When we running the tox, we are may always meeting the problem of
"db type could not be determined" on py34, we have to run the py34 first,
and then, run py27. So the patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini, which will
solve the problem above effectively.

Change-Id: I08fa26e8a637ee9ec6de9aeee932080f5194a78c
Closes-bug: #1612045

commit_message:
Added a test for delayed reap.

The test schedules a 3-second delayed account reaping.
The test checks that no reaping after an immediate reap, and that full reaping
occurs 3 seconds later.

Change-Id: I0ab954ed3c59d808f32d84dc53fd512fd0a651be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/41/321041/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mock import timefrom swift.account import reaper def test_delayed_reap(self): all_objects = [] # upload some containers for policy in ENABLED_POLICIES: container = 'container-%s-%s' % (policy.name, uuid.uuid4()) client.put_container(self.url, self.token, container, headers={'X-Storage-Policy': policy.name}) obj = 'object-%s' % uuid.uuid4() body = 'test-body' client.put_object(self.url, self.token, container, obj, body) all_objects.append((policy, container, obj)) Manager(['container-updater']).once() headers = client.head_account(self.url, self.token) self.assertEqual(int(headers['x-account-container-count']), len(ENABLED_POLICIES)) self.assertEqual(int(headers['x-account-object-count']), len(ENABLED_POLICIES)) self.assertEqual(int(headers['x-account-bytes-used']), len(ENABLED_POLICIES) * len(body)) part, nodes = self.account_ring.get_nodes(self.account) t = time.time() with mock.patch('swift.common.direct_client.time', mock.MagicMock(side_effect=[t])): for node in nodes: direct_delete_account(node, part, self.account) # define a reaper which is supposed to operate 10 seconds later account_reaper = reaper.AccountReaper({'swift_dir': '/etc/swift', 'delay_reaping': '10'}) # reap after 9 seconds, and make sure that nothing is reaped with mock.patch('swift.account.reaper.time', mock.MagicMock(side_effect=4 * [t + 9])): account_reaper.run_once() for policy, container, obj in all_objects: cpart, cnodes = self.container_ring.get_nodes( self.account, container) for cnode in cnodes: try: direct_head_container(cnode, cpart, self.account, container) except ClientException as err: self.fail("Nothing should reaped. Object should exist") else: pass object_ring = POLICIES.get_object_ring(policy.idx, '/etc/swift/') part, nodes = object_ring.get_nodes(self.account, container, obj) headers = {'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index': int(policy)} for node in nodes: try: direct_get_object(node, part, self.account, container, obj, headers=headers) except ClientException as err: self.fail("Nothing should reaped. Object should exist") else: pass # run replicators and updaters self.get_to_final_state() for policy, container, obj in all_objects: # verify that ALL container replicas are now deleted cpart, cnodes = self.container_ring.get_nodes( self.account, container) for cnode in cnodes: try: direct_head_container(cnode, cpart, self.account, container) except ClientException as err: self.fail("Nothing should reaped. Container should exist") else: pass object_ring = POLICIES.get_object_ring(policy.idx, '/etc/swift/') part, nodes = object_ring.get_nodes(self.account, container, obj) headers = {'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index': int(policy)} for node in nodes: try: direct_get_object(node, part, self.account, container, obj, headers=headers) except ClientException as err: self.fail("Nothing should reaped. Object should exist") else: pass # reap after 11 seconds, and make sure that all is reaped with mock.patch('swift.account.reaper.time', mock.MagicMock(side_effect=4 * [t + 11])): account_reaper.run_once() for policy, container, obj in all_objects: cpart, cnodes = self.container_ring.get_nodes( self.account, container) for cnode in cnodes: try: direct_head_container(cnode, cpart, self.account, container) except ClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) else: pass object_ring = POLICIES.get_object_ring(policy.idx, '/etc/swift/') part, nodes = object_ring.get_nodes(self.account, container, obj) headers = {'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index': int(policy)} for node in nodes: try: direct_get_object(node, part, self.account, container, obj, headers=headers) except ClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) else: self.fail('Found un-reaped /%s/%s/%s on %r in %s!' % (self.account, container, obj, node, policy)) # run replicators and updaters self.get_to_final_state() for policy, container, obj in all_objects: # verify that ALL container replicas are now deleted cpart, cnodes = self.container_ring.get_nodes( self.account, container) for cnode in cnodes: try: direct_head_container(cnode, cpart, self.account, container) except ClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) else: self.fail('Found un-reaped /%s/%s on %r' % (self.account, container, cnode)) # sanity check that object state is still consistent... object_ring = POLICIES.get_object_ring(policy.idx, '/etc/swift/') part, nodes = object_ring.get_nodes(self.account, container, obj) headers = {'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index': int(policy)} for node in nodes: try: direct_get_object(node, part, self.account, container, obj, headers=headers) except ClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) else: self.fail('Found un-reaped /%s/%s/%s on %r in %s!' % (self.account, container, obj, node, policy))

commit_message:
Further F24 kernel update

As described, I missed that we only keep *one* kernel during dib
build, so as soon as the upstream package updates, it suddenly becomes
the latest kernel and kicks our custom version out.

Guess what happened in the hours between me committing
I0769f005da1931658a5fb9e627983ed30c11d212 and the next dib build.

This will install the current latest kernel with the required patch.
As described in the comment, I have the fix committed upstream so we
can remove this whole thing when fedora rebuilds for the next stable
release (even if the patch isn't in the official stable tree yet).

Change-Id: Iafe6d88e3ac7a2ea23553a5011df920a2ee3317d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/83/353783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dnf install -y kernel-4.6.4-301.rhbz1361414.fc24 # Installing here seems to make it the default, and moves the other # kernel under the "advanced" menu. You'd think there'd be some # deterministic way to say "boot this kernel", but because it seems to # randomly shuffle under sub-menus this isn't the case... # This seems something like the least-worse way to do things if we # need to #echo "GRUB_DEFAULT=saved" >> /etc/default/grub #echo "GRUB_SAVEDEFAULT=false" >> /etc/default/grub #grub2-set-default 'Advanced options for Fedora 24 (Twenty Four)>Fedora (4.6.4-301.rhbz1361414.fc24.x86_64) 24 (Twenty Four)'
deleted_lines: dnf update -y # This seems something like the least-worse way to do things ...echo "GRUB_DEFAULT=saved" >> /etc/default/grub echo "GRUB_SAVEDEFAULT=false" >> /etc/default/grub grub2-set-default 'Advanced options for Fedora 24 (Twenty Four)>Fedora (4.6.4-301.rhbz1361414.fc24.x86_64) 24 (Twenty Four)'

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-12 18:06:47.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'overcloud.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/052e0f02bb85c9caade3017698e7ef7c404280f6', 'message': 'Add parameter for enabling purging configuration files

This patch adds a parameter, EnableConfigPurge, to the base nova and
neutron service files. The value is passed to their respective puppet
modules to control whether resources not managed by puppet are purged
from the config files. The default value is set to true.

Note: this is a "semantic" backport. Instead of "service files" the
modified files in Mitaka are the overcloud, controller and compute
templates. As alluded to in the original commit message *only* the
::neutron and ::nova classes are affected. Follow up patches are

	puppet/services/nova-base.yaml

Change-Id: I32732dc2ed7a7b3187e8727592cb4add0c6b9cf6

(cherry picked from commit f7f514cf67274b40f0f079d5349d7e9fda9d1790)
'}]
commit_message:
Add parameter for enabling purging configuration files

This patch adds a parameter, EnableConfigPurge, to the base nova and
neutron service files. The value is passed to their respective puppet
modules to control whether resources not managed by puppet are purged
from the config files. The default value is set to true.

Note: this is a "semantic" backport. Instead of "service files" the
modified files in Mitaka are the overcloud, controller and compute
templates. As alluded to in the original commit message *only* the
::neutron and ::nova classes are affected. Follow up patches are
required to proliferate purging to other TripleO generated
configuration.

Conflicts (files do not exist in Mitaka):
	puppet/services/neutron-base.yaml
	puppet/services/nova-base.yaml

Change-Id: I32732dc2ed7a7b3187e8727592cb4add0c6b9cf6
Closes-Bug:  #1611800
(cherry picked from commit f7f514cf67274b40f0f079d5349d7e9fda9d1790)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/78/354878/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EnableConfigPurge: default: true type: boolean description: > Where supported, remove configuration that is not generated by TripleO. Setting to false may result in configuration remnants after updates/upgrades. nova::purge_config: {get_input: purge_config} neutron::purge_config: {get_input: purge_config} purge_config: {get_param: EnableConfigPurge}

commit_message:
Consolidate Neutron config path in to a single var

This is a follow up from I8c4c7f513074fbd154ab253182b83227628d44ef
where it was proposed to consolidate the various static /etc/neutron
path entries in the role to a single var defined in the defaults.

Change-Id: Id2e8e4965bf6bda396e54ec8fe9586d920dcca00

commit_message:
Prepare v1 controller for version negotiation

Following up previous patch, this one is about preparing the v1 version
controller for micro-version negotiation.

Change-Id: I54da9b73ab0ec21472a663939b990cab598c1e93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/75/355375/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__get_version_controller(self, mock_vc): gvc = mock_vc.return_value xvc = mock.Mock() gvc.get_controller = mock.Mock(return_value=xvc) res = vnf._get_controller('v1.0', request) self.assertEqual(xvc, res) self.assertEqual(1, request.environ['api.major']) self.assertEqual(0, request.environ['api.minor']) gvc.get_controller.assert_called_once_with('1.0') def test__get_version_controller_shorter_version(self, mock_vc): gvc = mock_vc.return_value xvc = mock.Mock() gvc.get_controller = mock.Mock(return_value=xvc) vnf = vn.VersionNegotiationFilter(None, None) request = webob.Request({}) res = vnf._get_controller('v1', request) self.assertEqual(xvc, res) self.assertEqual(1, request.environ['api.major']) self.assertEqual(0, request.environ['api.minor']) gvc.get_controller.assert_called_once_with('1.0') def test__get_controller_not_match_version(self, mock_vc): gvc = mock_vc.return_value gvc.get_controller = mock.Mock(return_value=None) vnf = vn.VersionNegotiationFilter(None, None) request = webob.Request({}) res = vnf._get_controller("invalid", request) self.assertIsNone(res) self.assertEqual(0, gvc.get_controller.call_count) self.assertIsNone(response) self.assertIsNone(response) self.assertIsInstance(response, webob.exc.HTTPNotFound)
deleted_lines: def test_match_version_string(self, mock_vc): vnf = vn.VersionNegotiationFilter(None, None) request = webob.Request({}) major = 1 minor = 0 match = vnf._match_version_string('v{0}.{1}'.format(major, minor), request) self.assertTrue(match) self.assertEqual(major, request.environ['api.major']) self.assertEqual(minor, request.environ['api.minor']) def test_not_match_version_string(self, mock_vc): match = vnf._match_version_string("invalid", request) self.assertFalse(match) self.assertIs(mock_vc.return_value, response) self.assertIs(mock_vc.return_value, response) self.assertIsNone(response)

commit_message:
Set bay status: DELETE_IN_PROGRESS before updated by poll

Set bay status to DELETE_IN_PROGRESS as soon as delete stack
request returns. Currently this status is updated by Heat
poller.

Change-Id: I44a3cea1a5d6e9735b0b74637d7c62db2e9cffa3
Closes-Bug: #1612408

commit_message:
Add missing config file read to tempest init

The update_local_conf() portion of tempest init was never reading the
config file. In the case we prepopulate a tempest.conf from the global
state /etc dir this would result in tempest init duplicating options
and sections that already existed. This commit fixes the issue by
simply reading the file before we do any operations.

Also add test coverage to ensure existing settings are not overwritten.

Co-authored-by: Augustina Ragwitz <auggy@cpan.org>
Change-Id: Ie629df246fc40777f2017b78e4073ae833b64deb

commit_message:
Refactor test_cluster_deployment.js nightly test

* added common timeout 90sec for each test in the test suite
  because each test performs long runnning cluster actions
* added proper clean-up after each test to make tests independent
* optimized test suit setup: all needed variables are populated here

Change-Id: I3f222b8a365eba6f875549faa5f7bfb8307cff0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/46/341346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: var common, clusterPage, networksLib, dashboardPage, dashboardLib, nodesLib, node, modal, clusterName, controllers, computes, totalNodesAmount, nodeStatuses, clusterStatuses, timeout; node = new NodeComponent(this.remote); modal = new ModalWindow(this.remote); timeout = 90000; // tests in the suite include long runnning cluster tasks controllers = ['Supermicro X9DRW', 'Dell Inspiron']; computes = ['Supermicro X9SCD']; totalNodesAmount = controllers.length + computes.length; nodeStatuses = { ready: 'ready', provisioned: 'provisioned', new: 'pending_addition' }; clusterStatuses = { operational: 'Operational', partially_deployed: 'Partially Deployed' }; afterEach() { // do clean-up after each test to make them independent return this.remote .then(() => clusterPage.goToTab('Dashboard')) .then(() => clusterPage.resetEnvironment(clusterName)) .then(() => dashboardPage.discardChanges()); }, 'Check deployment/provisioning with node in "Offline"/"Error" state'() { this.timeout = timeout; .then(() => common.addNodesToCluster(computes.length, ['Compute'])) .then(() => dashboardLib.checkDeployModeState( totalNodesAmount, offlineNodesAmount, errorNodesAmount, 0, 0 )) .then(() => dashboardLib.checkProvisionModeState( totalNodesAmount, offlineNodesAmount, errorNodesAmount, 0, 0 )) .then(() => dashboardLib.checkDeploymentModeState( totalNodesAmount, offlineNodesAmount, errorNodesAmount, 0, 0 )) .then(() => dashboardLib.changeDeploymentMode('Deploy')); this.timeout = timeout; var provisionedNodesAmount = 1; .then(() => common.addNodesToCluster(controllers.length, ['Controller'])) .then(() => common.addNodesToCluster(computes.length, ['Compute'])) .then(() => dashboardLib.selectNodes( 'Provision', controllers.length, computes.length, provisionedNodesAmount, 0 )) .then(() => dashboardLib.provisionNodes( clusterName, totalNodesAmount, 0, 0, provisionedNodesAmount, 0 )) .then(() => dashboardLib.checkDeployModeState( totalNodesAmount, 0, 0, provisionedNodesAmount, 0 )) .then(() => dashboardLib.deployNodes( clusterName, totalNodesAmount, 0, 0, provisionedNodesAmount, 0 )) .then(() => dashboardLib.checkDeployModeState( totalNodesAmount, 0, 0, provisionedNodesAmount, totalNodesAmount )) .then(() => nodesLib.checkDeployResults( controllers[0], nodeStatuses.ready, controllers[1], nodeStatuses.ready, computes[0], nodeStatuses.ready, clusterName, clusterStatuses.operational )); 'Check node selection dialog supports Quick Search, Sorting and Filtering'() { this.timeout = timeout; var provisionedControllerAmount = 1; var provisionedComputeAmount = 1; var provisionedNodesAmount = provisionedControllerAmount + provisionedComputeAmount; commit_message:
Add 'deployed_before' flag to cluster that forbids stop deployment

When cluster is successfuly deployed, that is, has 'operational' status,
'deployed_before' key is added to generated attributes of the cluster.
This flag then is used to determine whether stop action is allowed for
the cluster.

Conflicts:
	nailgun/nailgun/objects/cluster.py
	nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_task_logging.py
	nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_verify_networks_task_manager.py
	nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_objects.py

commit_message:
Add 'deployed_before' flag to cluster that forbids stop deployment

When cluster is successfuly deployed, that is, has 'operational' status,
'deployed_before' key is added to generated attributes of the cluster.
This flag then is used to determine whether stop action is allowed for
the cluster.

Conflicts:

added_lines: Install Fuel Plugin Builder on Fuel Master Node ----------------------------------------------- You may install the Fuel Plugin Builder on the Fuel Master node. You may use the Fuel Master node as the build environment. This should display ``4.0.0``. Install Fuel Plugin Builder on Ubuntu 14.04 ------------------------------------------- You may install the Fuel Plugin Builder on Ubuntu 14.04. **To install the Fuel Plugin Builder** #. Install the required packages: .. code-block:: console sudo apt-get install -y ruby-dev rubygems-integration python-pip rpm createrepo dpkg-dev #. Install the Fuel Plugin Builder: .. code-block:: console gem install fpm pip install fuel-plugin-builder
deleted_lines: Install Fuel Plugin Builder --------------------------- You must install the Fuel Plugin Builder on the Fuel Master node. You must use the Fuel Master node as the build environment. This should display ``4.0.0``.

commit_message:
Make use of oslo-config-generator

oslo_config provide a utility for generating sample config files,
which provide more detail about opts, like Minimum/Maximum value
and Allowed values.

After this patch, new config options of masakari code should register
with masakari/conf/opts.py.

Change-Id: I8f2f7e87268498ebee7ca164db1c98ef43c279b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/67/353867/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Dictionary creation could be rewritten with dictionary literal

Instead of adding key-value pair individually, added them at
the time of creation itself.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If399250f582620c243512248acd16dff72764052

commit_message:
Remove "visibility" and "protected" in 3.0 microversion

When "--os-volume-api-version 3.0" is passed to "cinder upload-to-image"
command, cinderclient should not access cinder-api with argument
"visibility" and "protected".

Change-Id: Iafaf2feae66cb8bf78a1478ba6ba3d8f4ead1a36
Closes-Bug: #1589040
Depends-On: I398cbd02b61f30918a427291d1d3ae00435e0f4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/67/336767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 FUJITSU LIMITED # # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from cinderclient import api_versions from cinderclient import exceptions from cinderclient.tests.unit import utils from cinderclient.tests.unit.v3 import fakes from cinderclient.v3.volumes import Volume from cinderclient.v3.volumes import VolumeManager class VolumesTest(utils.TestCase): def test_upload_to_image(self): # test for lib users who call Volume's upload_to_image() # function expected = {'os-volume_upload_image': {'force': False, 'container_format': 'bare', 'disk_format': 'raw', 'image_name': 'name', 'visibility': 'private', 'protected': True}} api_version = api_versions.APIVersion('3.1') cs = fakes.FakeClient(api_version) manager = VolumeManager(cs) fake_volume = Volume(manager, {'id': 1234, 'name': 'sample-volume'}, loaded=True) fake_volume.upload_to_image(False, 'name', 'bare', 'raw', protected=True) cs.assert_called_anytime('POST', '/volumes/1234/action', body=expected) def test_upload_to_image_unsupport_attr(self): # microversion 3.0 doesn't support visibility and protected # for lib users api_version = api_versions.APIVersion('3.0') manager = VolumeManager(fakes.FakeClient(api_version)) fake_volume = Volume(manager, {'id': 1234, 'name': 'sample-volume'}, loaded=True) self.assertRaises(exceptions.UnsupportedAttribute, fake_volume.upload_to_image, False, 'name', 'bare', 'raw', visibility='private', protected=False)

commit_message:
Tests for testing volume-create command

Positive tests for the cinder CLI commands which check actions with
volume create command like create volume from snapshot,
create volume from volume.

Change-Id: I77912d413ac061eb8376233dfef772c55265d135
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/74/343474/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class CinderVolumeTests(base.ClientTestBase): """Check of cinder volume create commands.""" def test_volume_create_from_snapshot(self): pass def test_volume_create_from_volume(self): pass def test_volume_create_from_replicated_volume(self): pass def test_volume_create_from_image_id(self): pass

commit_message:
Add backup-update

Add backup-update command to update name and description
of a backup.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie24b2a13f8d1132b65f30e95059479e532fad41a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/84/263184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('backup', metavar='<backup>', help='Name or ID of backup to rename.') @utils.arg('name', nargs='?', metavar='<name>', help='New name for backup.') @utils.arg('--description', metavar='<description>', default=None, help='Backup description. Default=None.') @utils.arg('--display-description', help=argparse.SUPPRESS) @utils.arg('--display_description', help=argparse.SUPPRESS) @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_backup_rename(cs, args): """Renames a backup.""" kwargs = {} if args.name is not None: kwargs['name'] = args.name if args.description is not None: kwargs['description'] = args.description elif args.display_description is not None: kwargs['description'] = args.display_description if not any(kwargs): msg = 'Must supply either name or description.' raise exceptions.ClientException(code=1, message=msg) _find_backup(cs, args.backup).update(**kwargs)

commit_message:
Get 500 Internal server error when retrieving secret with no payload

When you store a secret without payload, and then try to retrieve
that secret's payload, you will get an error of "500 internal
server error", this patch fix that.

Closes-Bug: #1590972
Change-Id: Ifddfa4da7bc8fe3749d208e79b9795a929bb2c9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/86/343986/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _secret_payload_not_found(): """Throw exception indicating secret's payload is not found.""" pecan.abort(404, u._('Not Found. Sorry but your secret has no payload.')) # check if payload exists before proceeding if not secret.encrypted_data and not secret.secret_store_metadata: _secret_payload_not_found()

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Add link credit configuration options

Change-Id: Ifd483dfc67a4ff18f2047dbdca0aab311124627f
Closes-Bug: 1367911
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/19/349719/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, connection, on_ready, on_down, capacity): self._capacity = capacity self._capacity_low = (capacity + 1) / 2 def receiver_active(self, receiver): """This is a Pyngus callback, invoked by Pyngus when the receiver link receiver.add_capacity(self._capacity) def receiver_failed(self, receiver, error): def receiver_closed(self, receiver): LOG.debug("Received response for msg id=%s", key) try: except KeyError: if receiver.capacity < self._capacity_low: receiver.add_capacity(self._capacity - receiver.capacity) def __init__(self, target, incoming, scheduler, delay, capacity): self._capacity = capacity # credit per link self._capacity_low = (capacity + 1) / 2 if receiver.capacity < self._capacity_low: def __init__(self, target, incoming, scheduler, delay, capacity): super(RPCServer, self).__init__(target, incoming, scheduler, delay, capacity) def __init__(self, target, incoming, scheduler, delay, capacity): delay, capacity) # credit levels for incoming links self._reply_credit = _opts.reply_link_credit self._rpc_credit = _opts.rpc_server_credit self._notify_credit = _opts.notify_server_credit self.link_retry_delay, self._notify_credit) self.link_retry_delay, self._rpc_credit) self._reply_link_down, self._reply_credit)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, connection, on_ready, on_down): self.capacity = 100 # TODO(kgiusti) guesstimate - make configurable self._credit = 0 def receiver_active(self, receiver_link): """This is a Pyngus callback, invoked by Pyngus when the receiver_link self._update_credit() def receiver_failed(self, receiver_link, error): def receiver_closed(self, receiver_link): self._credit = self._credit - 1 self._update_credit() if key in self._correlation: LOG.debug("Received response for msg id=%s", key) else: def _update_credit(self): if self._credit < self.capacity / 2: self._receiver.add_capacity(self.capacity - self._credit) self._credit = self.capacity def __init__(self, target, incoming, scheduler, delay): self._capacity = 500 # credit per link if receiver.capacity < self._capacity / 2: # TODO(kgiusti) Hardcoding credit here is sub-optimal. A better # approach would monitor for a back-up of inbound messages to be # processed by the consuming application and backpressure the # sender based on configured thresholds. def __init__(self, target, incoming, scheduler, delay): super(RPCServer, self).__init__(target, incoming, scheduler, delay) def __init__(self, target, incoming, scheduler, delay): delay) self.link_retry_delay) self.link_retry_delay) self._reply_link_down)

commit_message:
[config-ref] update Object Storage rsyncd configurations

* Split rsyncd configuration into a separate file
* Add description for no help options
* Delete improper configuration option tables

backport: mitaka

Change-Id: Idd530b1df730eca197faadb9dd61753b130be919
Partial-Bug: #1605040
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/44/353244/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This table is manually created. .. list-table:: Description of configuration options in ``rsyncd.conf`` :header-rows: 1 :class: config-ref-table * - Configuration option = Default value - Description * - ``gid`` = ``swift`` - Group ID for rsyncd. * - ``log file`` = ``/var/log/rsyncd.log`` - Log file for rsyncd. * - ``pid file`` = ``/var/run/rsyncd.pid`` - PID file for rsyncd. * - ``uid`` = ``swift`` - User ID for rsyncd. * - ``max connections`` = - Maximum number of connections for rsyncd. This option should be set for each account, container, or object. * - ``path`` = ``/srv/node`` - Working directory for rsyncd to use. This option should be set for each account, container, or object. * - ``read only`` = ``false`` - Set read only. This option should be set for each account, container, or object. * - ``lock file`` = - Lock file for rsyncd. This option should be set for each account, container, or object.

commit_message:
Add tearDown to resolve 410 Account Gone

Change-Id: I5e9bd80e1a4a8fa364f5e6d7acb4f8695f2192ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/08/355308/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.account import reaper, replicator def tearDown(self): for conf_file in self.configs['account-server'].values(): conf = utils.readconf(conf_file, 'account-replicator') conf['reclaim_age'] = '0' # reclaim the deleted db immediately, otherwise, the next reap # test will fail because of 410 GONE at setting up. replicator.AccountReplicator(conf).run_once()

commit_message:
Add snapshot instances admin CLIs

Support new API entry points for share snapshot instances:
- share-snapshot-instance-list
- share-snapshot-instance-show
- share-snapshot-instance-reset-status

Implements: blueprint snapshot-instances
Change-Id: Ica1e81012f19926e0f1ba9cd6d8eecc5fbbf40b5

subject: 'As of' in documentation is incorrect
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 03:00:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/architecture.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/22a6569dad5add607fd67a212345ae6880facd08', 'message': "'As of' in documentation is incorrect

The documentation has 'As of the Newton release...'. 'As of' is
used to indicate the time or date from which something starts.
In this context, that is incorrect; we want to indicate that

Change-Id: I080694d2f4e2b6d3b53e1b2f15b96f59b3eb16cf
"}]
commit_message:
'As of' in documentation is incorrect

The documentation has 'As of the Newton release...'. 'As of' is
used to indicate the time or date from which something starts.
In this context, that is incorrect; we want to indicate that
the Newton release is the last/end release.

Change-Id: I080694d2f4e2b6d3b53e1b2f15b96f59b3eb16cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/27/353227/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In releases prior to and including the Newton release, it's possible to bind periodic tasks to a driver object instead of an interface. This is deprecated and support for it will be removed in the Ocata release.
deleted_lines: As of the Newton release, it's possible to bind periodic tasks to a driver object instead of an interface. This is deprecated and support for it will be removed in the Ocata release.

commit_message:
Add nova scheduler_host_subset_size option to docs

This should be set higher than the number of nodes in the deployment,
because otherwise nova will continue to pick the same nodes as instances
cycle out, meaning some machines may never be used while others get many
instances provisioned.

This also helps with scheduler races when booting a large number of
instances at the same time.

Change-Id: I5a898616743105fe5410d7370a91e5c60120b596
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/69/350569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # New instances will be scheduled on a host chosen randomly from a subset of the # N best hosts, where N is the value set by this option. Valid values are 1 or # greater. Any value less than one will be treated as 1. # For ironic, this should be set to a number >= the number of ironic nodes # to more evenly distribute instances across the nodes. #scheduler_host_subset_size=1 scheduler_host_subset_size=9999999

Create a new class to handle all configuration for
keystone_authtoken section in configuration file using
keystone::resource::authtoken

This patch is not backward compatible, we have change
auth_type in api.pp to auth_strategy.

Some deprecations:
- barbican::api::auth_url is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::auth_url
- barbican::api::keystone_auth_type is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::auth_type
- barbican::api::keystone_password is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::password
- barbican::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::project_name
- barbican::api::keystone_user is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::username
- barbican::api::project_domain_id is deprecated, use
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::project_domain_name
- barbican::api::user_domain_id is deprecated, use
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::user_domain_name

Change-Id: I2dee8a3d1c399234941f96d8f21f49526777f501
Related-Bug: #1604463

auth_type in api.pp to auth_strategy.

Some deprecations:
- barbican::api::auth_url is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::auth_url
- barbican::api::keystone_auth_type is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::auth_type
- barbican::api::keystone_password is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::password
- barbican::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::project_name
- barbican::api::keystone_user is deprecated in favor of
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::username
- barbican::api::project_domain_id is deprecated, use
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::project_domain_name
- barbican::api::user_domain_id is deprecated, use
  barbican::keystone::authtoken::user_domain_name

Change-Id: I2dee8a3d1c399234941f96d8f21f49526777f501
Related-Bug: #1604463

commit_message:
Move barbican to authtoken

Create a new class to handle all configuration for
keystone_authtoken section in configuration file using
keystone::resource::authtoken

This patch is not backward compatible:
- we have change auth_type in api.pp to auth_strategy,
because auth_type is related to keystone authentication.
- removed all parameters related to keystone_authtoken
from api.pp and moved to authtoken.pp

Change-Id: I2dee8a3d1c399234941f96d8f21f49526777f501
Depends-On: I94914ed5a8b5c1447606547b31ed46bb72b4de01
Related-Bug: #1604463
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/05/347105/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*auth_strategy*]# = Keystone Middleware parameters # # [*username*] # (optional) The name of the service user # Defaults to 'barbican' # # [*password*] # (required) Password for the user # # [*auth_uri*] # (optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to 'http://localhost:5000' # # [*auth_url*] # (optional) The URL to use for authentication. # Defaults to 'http://localhost:35357' # # [*project_name*] # (optional) Service project name # Defaults to 'services' # # [*user_domain_name*] # (optional) Name of domain for $username # Defaults to 'Default' # # [*project_domain_name*] # (optional) Name of domain for $project_name # Defaults to 'Default' # # [*insecure*] # (optional) If true, explicitly allow TLS without checking server cert # against any certificate authorities. # WARNING: not recommended. Use with caution. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*auth_section*] # (optional) Config Section from which to load plugin specific options # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*auth_type*] # (optional) Authentication type to load # Defaults to 'password' # # [*auth_version*] # (optional) API version of the admin Identity API endpoint # for example, use 'v3' for the keystone version 3.0 api # Defaults to-$::os_service_default # # [*cache*] # (optional) Env key for the swift cache. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*cafile*] # (optional) A PEM encoded Certificate Authority to use when verifying HTTPs # connections # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*certfile*] # (optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*check_revocations_for_cached*] # (optional) If true, the revocation list will be checked for cached tokens. # This requires that PKI tokens are configured on the identity server. # boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*delay_auth_decision*] # (optional) Do not handle authorization requests within the middleware, but # delegate the authorization decision to downstream WSGI components. Boolean # value # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*enforce_token_bind*] # (Optional) Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set # to: "disabled" to not check token binding. "permissive" (default) to # validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the # server and ignore it if not. "strict" like "permissive" but if the bind # type is unknown the token will be rejected. "required" any form of token # binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method that # must be present in tokens. String value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*hash_algorithms*] # (Optional) Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a # single algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python # standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so # put # the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first hash will # be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only # while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more secure one. Once # all # the old tokens are expired this option should be set to a single value for # better performance. List value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*http_connect_timeout*] # (optional) Request timeout value for communicating with Identity API # server. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*http_request_max_retries*] # (optional) How many times are we trying to reconnect when communicating # with Identity API Server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*include_service_catalog*] # (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If False, # middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation and will # not # set the X-Service-Catalog header. Boolean value. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*keyfile*] # (Optional) Required if identity server requires client certificate # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a # memcached # client connection from the pool. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_dead_retry*] # (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it # is tried again. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_maxsize*] # (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached # server. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_socket_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_pool_unused_timeout*] # (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in # the pool before it is closed. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_secret_key*] # (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string # is used for key derivation. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_security_strategy*] # (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be authenticated # or authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is authenticated (with # HMAC) in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is encrypted and authenticated # in the cache. If the value is not one of these options or empty, # auth_token will raise an exception on initialization. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcache_use_advanced_pool*] # (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The # advanced pool will only work under python 2.x Boolean value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*memcached_servers*] # (Optional) Optionally specify a list of memcached server(s) to use for # caching. If left undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*region_name*] # (Optional) The region in which the identity server can be found. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*revocation_cache_time*] # (Optional) Determines the frequency at which the list of revoked tokens is # retrieved from the Identity service (in seconds). A high number of # revocation events combined with a low cache duration may significantly # reduce performance. Only valid for PKI tokens. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*signing_dir*] # (Optional) Directory used to cache files related to PKI tokens. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # [*token_cache_time*] # (Optional) In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, # the middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration # (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely. Integer value # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # # = DEPRECATED ## (optional) DEPRECATED. Use auth_type instead. # Defaults to undef # # [*keystone_password*] # (optional) DEPRECATED. Use password instead. # Defaults to undef # # [*keystone_tenant*] # (optional) DEPRECATED. Use project_name instead. # Defaults to undef # # [*keystone_user*] # (optional) DEPRECATED. Use username instead. # Defaults to undef # # [*project_domain_id*] # (optional) DEPRECATED. Use project_domain_name instead. # Defaults to undef # # [*user_domain_id*] # (optional) DEPRECATED. Use user_domain_name instead. # Defaults to undef $auth_strategy = 'keystone', # Keystone middleware parameters $username = 'barbican', $password = $::os_service_default, $auth_url = 'http://localhost:35357', $auth_uri = 'http://localhost:5000', $auth_version = $::os_service_default, $project_name = 'services', $user_domain_name = 'Default', $project_domain_name = 'Default', $insecure = $::os_service_default, $auth_section = $::os_service_default, $auth_type = 'password', $cache = $::os_service_default, $cafile = $::os_service_default, $certfile = $::os_service_default, $check_revocations_for_cached = $::os_service_default, $delay_auth_decision = $::os_service_default, $enforce_token_bind = $::os_service_default, $hash_algorithms = $::os_service_default, $::os_service_default, $memcache_secret_key = $::os_service_default, $memcache_security_strategy = $::os_service_default, $memcache_use_advanced_pool = $::os_service_default, $::os_service_default, $token_cache_time = $::os_service_default, # Deprecated $keystone_auth_type = undef, $keystone_password = undef, $keystone_tenant = undef, $keystone_user = undef, deleted_lines: # [*auth_type*]# [*auth_url*] # (optional) identity server URI, needed for keystone auth # Defaults to 'http://localhost:35357' ## [*keystone_password*] # (required) Password used to authentication. # # [*keystone_tenant*] # (optional) Tenant to authenticate to. # Defaults to 'services'. # # [*keystone_user*] # (optional) User to authenticate as with keystone. # Defaults to 'barbican'. # # [*project_domain_id*] # (optional) Auth user project's domain ID # Defaults to 'default' # # [*user_domain_id*] # (optional) Auth user's domain ID # Defaults to 'default' ## (optional) An authentication plugin to use with an OpenStack Identity server. # Defaults to 'password' $auth_type = 'keystone', $auth_url = 'http://localhost:35357', $keystone_password = undef, $keystone_tenant = 'services', $keystone_user = 'barbican', $project_domain_id = 'default', $user_domain_id = 'default', $keystone_auth_type = 'password', if $auth_type == 'keystone' { if $keystone_password == undef { fail('keystone_password must be defined') barbican_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_type': value => $keystone_auth_type; 'keystone_authtoken/auth_url': value => $auth_url; 'keystone_authtoken/project_name': value => $keystone_tenant; 'keystone_authtoken/username': value => $keystone_user; 'keystone_authtoken/password': value => $keystone_password, secret => true; 'keystone_authtoken/user_domain_id': value => $user_domain_id; 'keystone_authtoken/project_domain_id': value => $project_domain_id; } barbican_config { 'keystone_authtoken/auth_plugin': ensure => 'absent'; 'keystone_authtoken/auth_type': ensure => 'absent'; 'keystone_authtoken/auth_uri': ensure => 'absent'; 'keystone_authtoken/project_name': ensure => 'absent'; 'keystone_authtoken/username': ensure => 'absent'; 'keystone_authtoken/password': ensure => 'absent'; 'keystone_authtoken/user_domain_id': ensure => 'absent'; 'keystone_authtoken/project_domain_id': ensure => 'absent'; }

commit_message:
functions: clone poi mitaka when cloning ceph/hammer

When submitting a patch in puppet-ceph stable/hammer, we want to clone
puppet-openstack-integration from stable/mitaka.

This patch makes sure of that.

Change-Id: I7a7190f0c9e7257f74672d8a8d63678706c63243

""" return self._update_config("config", config) def import_admin_credentials(self, username, password): """Imports the KDC Account Manager credentials needed by Cloudera Manager to create kerberos principals needed by CDH services. :param username Username of the Account Manager. Full name including the Kerberos realm must be specified. :param password Password for the Account Manager. :return: Information about the submitted command. :since: API v7 """ return self._cmd('importAdminCredentials', params=dict( username=username, password=password))

commit_message:
Fix useless api_version of Manager class

Manager's api_version property is used by api_version.wraps. It
should not be an "empty" class and the real api_version can be
read from Client class.

Change-Id: Ib9dbd6d4243d94271b24177555193fcea27afcea
Closes-Bug: #1573414

added_lines: class ManagerTest(utils.TestCase): def test_api_version(self): # The function manager.return_api_version has two versions, # when called with api version 3.1 it should return the # string '3.1' and when called with api version 3.2 or higher # it should return the string '3.2'. version = api_versions.APIVersion('3.1') api = client.Client(api_version=version) manager = test_utils.FakeManagerWithApi(api) self.assertEqual('3.1', manager.return_api_version()) version = api_versions.APIVersion('3.2') api = client.Client(api_version=version) manager = test_utils.FakeManagerWithApi(api) self.assertEqual('3.2', manager.return_api_version()) # pick up the highest version version = api_versions.APIVersion('3.3') api = client.Client(api_version=version) manager = test_utils.FakeManagerWithApi(api) self.assertEqual('3.2', manager.return_api_version()) version = api_versions.APIVersion('3.0') api = client.Client(api_version=version) manager = test_utils.FakeManagerWithApi(api) # An exception will be returned here because the function # return_api_version doesn't support version 3.0 self.assertRaises(exceptions.VersionNotFoundForAPIMethod, manager.return_api_version)

commit_message:
Add credential functional tests

Adds functional tests for credentials.

Change-Id: Ia483c47956747a241bc521c0e67a874e794d709c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/57/348557/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from keystoneauth1.exceptions import http from keystoneclient.tests.functional import base from keystoneclient.tests.functional.v3 import client_fixtures as fixtures class CredentialsTestCase(base.V3ClientTestCase): def check_credential(self, credential, credential_ref=None): self.assertIsNotNone(credential.id) self.assertIn('self', credential.links) self.assertIn('/credentials/' + credential.id, credential.links['self']) if credential_ref: self.assertEqual(credential_ref['user'], credential.user_id) self.assertEqual(credential_ref['type'], credential.type) # There is no guarantee below attributes are present in credential if hasattr(credential_ref, 'blob'): self.assertEqual(credential_ref['blob'], credential.blob) if hasattr(credential_ref, 'data'): self.assertEqual(credential_ref['data'], credential.data) if hasattr(credential_ref, 'project'): self.assertEqual(credential_ref['project'], credential.project) else: # Only check remaining mandatory attributes self.assertIsNotNone(credential.user_id) self.assertIsNotNone(credential.type) def test_create_credential_of_cert_type(self): user = fixtures.User(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(user) credential_ref = {'user': user.id, 'type': 'cert', 'blob': uuid.uuid4().hex} credential = self.client.credentials.create(**credential_ref) self.addCleanup(self.client.credentials.delete, credential) self.check_credential(credential, credential_ref) def test_create_credential_of_ec2_type(self): user = fixtures.User(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(user) project = fixtures.Project(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(project) # credential_ref = {'user': user.id, # 'type': 'ec2', # 'blob': uuid.uuid4().hex, # 'project': project.id} # credential = self.client.credentials.create(**credential_ref) # self.addCleanup(self.client.credentials.delete, credential) # self.check_credential(credential, credential_ref) def test_get_credential_of_cert_type(self): user = fixtures.User(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(user) credential = fixtures.Credential(self.client, user=user.id, type='cert', blob=uuid.uuid4().hex) self.useFixture(credential) credential_ret = self.client.credentials.get(credential.id) self.check_credential(credential_ret, credential.ref) def test_list_credentials_of_cert_type(self): user = fixtures.User(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(user) credential_one = fixtures.Credential(self.client, user=user.id, type='cert', blob=uuid.uuid4().hex) self.useFixture(credential_one) project = fixtures.Project(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(project) credential_two = fixtures.Credential(self.client, user=user.id, type='cert', blob=uuid.uuid4().hex, project=project.id) self.useFixture(credential_two) credentials = self.client.credentials.list() # All credentials are valid for credential in credentials: self.check_credential(credential) self.assertIn(credential_one.entity, credentials) self.assertIn(credential_two.entity, credentials) def test_update_credential(self): user = fixtures.User(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(user) new_user = fixtures.User(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(new_user) domain = fixtures.Domain(self.client) self.useFixture(domain) new_project = fixtures.Project(self.client, domain.id) self.useFixture(new_project) credential = fixtures.Credential(self.client, user=user.id, type='cert', blob=uuid.uuid4().hex) self.useFixture(credential) new_type = uuid.uuid4().hex new_blob = uuid.uuid4().hex credential_ret = self.client.credentials.update(credential.id, user=new_user.id, type=new_type, blob=new_blob, project=new_project.id) credential.ref.update({'user': new_user.id, 'type': new_type, 'blob': new_blob, 'project': new_project.id}) self.check_credential(credential_ret, credential.ref) def test_delete_credential(self): user = fixtures.User(self.client, self.project_domain_id) self.useFixture(user) credential = self.client.credentials.create(user=user.id, type='cert', blob=uuid.uuid4().hex) self.client.credentials.delete(credential.id) self.assertRaises(http.NotFound, self.client.credentials.get, credential.id)

commit_message:
Better control of mariadb restarts in upgrades

This commit adds additional control around how the galera cluster
nodes are restarted during an upgrade (both the openstack upgrade
as well as mariadb upgrade). lxc config that gets added during the
lxc-container-create play would normally force a container restart.
This commit essentially does the following:

- run lxc-container-create on galera nodes but prevent container restarts
  from being triggered by the new lxc config that gets laid down
- run a mariadb upgrade
- run a controlled rolling restart of all mariadb cluster containers

(cherry picked from commit fd690e1fc3e9c90a0676e87ed8453b9dd33fe4c6)

Conflicts:
	scripts/run-upgrade.sh

Change-Id: I5d979eb15c471274cc14ce6f41c8ae479c5131d6

subject: Remove the redundant verification in OAuth1 authorization
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-31 09:20:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/oauth1/controllers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/b26200beb80adcc48ef3d63d065962aa37df0031', 'message': 'Remove the redundant verification in OAuth1 authorization

The code verify the assignment filtered by `user_id` after
verifying the assignment filtered by `user_id` and `project_id`.

The latter should be a subset of the former.

Change-Id: I056f543a1dfbd0ad8965cdd37bb986a665711ab7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the redundant verification in OAuth1 authorization

The code verify the assignment filtered by `user_id` after
verifying the assignment filtered by `user_id` and `project_id`.

The latter should be a subset of the former.

Change-Id: I056f543a1dfbd0ad8965cdd37bb986a665711ab7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/47/349247/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # verify the user has the project too req_project_id = req_token['requested_project_id'] user_projects = self.assignment_api.list_projects_for_user(user_id) for user_project in user_projects: if user_project['id'] == req_project_id: break else: msg = _("User is not a member of the requested project") raise exception.Unauthorized(message=msg)

commit_message:
Add IPv6 DNS support

Now that osic-cloud1 is only using IPv6 public IPs, we can also add
IPv6 support for unbound.

Change-Id: I9da5a06fdbea04b322cddf6c7e6e829e47492d4c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
kerberos infra deployment impl

this change implements support of deploying
kerberos infrastucture, including kdc server
and setting up clients. can be tested on fake
plugin.

Partially-implements bp: initial-kerberos-integration

Change-Id: I328c3ecbbc712b3a9d48a6a7248ec28477ec0f5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/53/345953/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [kdcdefaults] kdc_ports = 750,88 [realms] %(realm_name)s = { database_name = /var/lib/krb5kdc/principal admin_keytab = FILE:/etc/krb5kdc/kadm5.keytab acl_file = /etc/krb5kdc/kadm5.acl key_stash_file = /etc/krb5kdc/stash kdc_ports = 750,88 max_life = 10h 0m 0s max_renewable_life = 7d 0h 0m 0s master_key_type = des3-hmac-sha1 supported_enctypes = aes256-cts:normal arcfour-hmac:normal des3-hmac-sha1:normal des-cbc-crc:normal des:normal des:v4 des:norealm des:onlyrealm des:afs3 default_principal_flags = +preauth, +renewable, +forwardable }

commit_message:
Move other-requirements.txt to bindep.txt

The default filename for documenting binary dependencies has been
changed from "other-requirements.txt" to "bindep.txt" with the release
of bindep 2.1.0. While the previous name is still supported, it will
be deprecated.

Move the file around to follow this change.

Note that this change is self-testing, the OpenStack CI infrastructure
will use a "bindep.txt" file to setup nodes for testing.

For more information about bindep, see also:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#package-requirements
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/bindep/

As well as this announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101590.html

Change-Id: I3cf19cf423de4a65700a1eb30a2d8f43d64af278
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/56/354956/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[DOCS] Move over the Neutron Plugins docs

This change moves the Neutron Plugin documents for Plumgrid and Nuage
over to the Neutron role.  Moving forward, specific project
configurations are maintained in the appropriate role book.

Change-Id: I5d2d6a38419a879862c98f21e094d094a4857b62
